div1.p: Hench discusses efforts to preserve Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Honorato Colete, July 13, 1948
div1.opener:
July 13, 1948
Mr. Honorato Colete
Habana 254
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Colete:
div1.p:
I was so pleased to receive your recent letter telling me of your
conferences with Vice President Cardenas, Doctor Carbonell and Doctor Andreu.
I am delighted to know that the plans are proceeding and that the little
memorial will be started soon. It will give my colleagues here at the Mayo
Clinic and the American medical profession in general much pleasure to know
of the joint memorial to Doctors Finlay and Reed and their colleagues. Their
contribution to the world deserves our continued homage.

I understand that your government does not see fit to accept my
personal offer to pay for the erection of a protecting shed. I was glad
indeed to have made the offer and was happy in the assurance that you and
your colleagues will protect the caseta until such time as the memorial can
be built. I do hope indeed that I can have the honor of being notified so
that I may attend the dedication of the memorial and I shall be happy to
hear of any further developments.

Thank you for your promise to send me the air views. They will be
most useful.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
